data.title: Banashankari Metro Station: Timings, Routes And Facilities
data.meta_description: New in Bangalore? Then you should know about Banashankari Metro Station, a vital station. Learn about the timings, routes, etc. here!
data.text:
Have you just moved to the Silicon Valley of India? We know how the traffic can dampen your spirit of exploring the city since Bangalore has so much to offer! Don’t worry, the city blesses daily commuters and tourists with Namma Metro – Bangalore’s metro system. With Green and Purple lines in operation, and Yellow and Pink lines yet to open, the metro services ensure a hassle-free journey. As we cover Green Line Metro, today we will talk about Banashankari Metro Station, a key station in the bustling city of Bangalore. Here, you will find out everything about the metro station, facilities, metro timings, and routes. Let’s take a look below!

About Banashankari Metro Station

Banashankari Metro Station, located on Kanakapura Road, is a vital node on the Green Line of Namma Metro. Started its journey on June 18, 2017, it is an elevated station connecting passengers from suburban areas to central business districts. With two side platforms and a structured layout, the metro station ensures a seamless commuting experience. In addition, Banashankari Metro Station stretches from Nagasandra to Silk Institute, offering efficient connectivity to different parts of the city.

Facilities Available at Banashankari Metro Station

Banashankari Metro Station aims to offer not only an efficient experience for commuters but also a comfortable one. This Green Line Metro route is equipped with an array of facilities to ensure the maximum convenience, accessibility, and safety for passengers. For easy access to platforms, especially for passengers with disabilities, lifts are available. In addition, surveillance cameras are installed throughout the station to enhance security and monitor activities, ensuring a safe environment for all commuters. Furthermore, the metro station is well-connected with BMTC buses at the Banashankari TTMC to ensure further connectivity.

The Banashankari Metro Station serves as a critical link on the Green Line of Bengaluru’s Namma Metro network. To ensure you have a smooth journey, here’s a brief of operational timings:

Places to Visit Near Banashankari Metro

Banashankari Metro Station has established itself as not just a transportation hub but as a gateway to a vibrant neighbourhood. From serene temples to bustling markets, there is something for everyone to explore. Here are a few places to visit near Banashankari Metro Station:

1. Kempegowda Park

Open from 6 am to 9:30 am and 4:30 pm to 9:30 pm every day, it’s a good place to relax and enjoy the outdoors. With a walking track, garden, and playground, Kempegowda Park is perfect for morning or evening walks.

2. Sri Banashankari Temple

The distance from Banashankari Metro Station to Banashankari Temple is 350 metres, making the metro station a widely-used transportation hub. Nevertheless, Banashankari Temple is a popular pilgrimage destination that is beautifully decorated with statues and oil lamps. The temple is open 24 hours a day and offers a spectacular view of the city.

3. Devagiri Varaprada Sri Venkateshawara Gudi

Located 2.3 km away from this Green Line metro station, the temple is dedicated to Lord Venkateswara. The temple has two ornately carved, colourful gates perched at Devagiri hillock. Open from 8:30 am to 12 pm and 5:30 pm to 8 pm, the temple is a popular destination among the devotees across the city.
